page.title: 05FARMING AT TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: The fertile red sandstone soil of the Teme Valley allows almost any crop to be grown successfully. Farms average 200 acres mainly family owned and worked or worked by the farmer tenant with very little paid help. Most fields are intensively managed grassland or cultivated with non-grass crops. Animals are mainly sheep with store cattle but few milking herds. There are several medium sized cattle markets 15-20 miles from the area. Milking parlours work on the herringbone system and some farmers link their milking cows to computerised records to check fertility and yields. Most farms have some arable, small cereal fields or potato crops. Potato acreages are governed by a marketing board. There is a small experimental deer farm producing venison.
